task_summary: Perceive the bread on the table, approach and align to it, then move it by pushing along the tabletop and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop scene shows multiple small items (cans, bottles, cup) and a rectangular bread-like item. The robot arm must move the bread without lifting it. The plan is to first ensure the bread is visible, then localize it precisely, approach and align the end-effector, execute a short push along the table surface to translate the bread, and finally retreat to a safe pose. No target goal marker is visible, so the move is interpreted as a short reposition.
preconditions: Table surface is clear enough to allow a short push
Robot has free workspace in front of bread
Gripper open / not required for pushing
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of bread; if not visible, scan the scene.
Detect and localize the bread pose.
Approach and align to the bread with tight tolerance.
Push the bread a short distance along the table.
success_criteria: Bread translates on the tabletop by the commanded distance/direction
Robot leaves the scene in a safe state
failure_and_recovery: If bread not detected: perform scan and retry perception
If alignment fails: reattempt approach and refine tolerance
If push slips or stalls: reduce distance and retry once
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful push and retreat or after perception/push failures are reported.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if bread is currently visible.
Active scan to locate bread if not visible.
Run detector to localize bread precisely.
Approach bread and align end-effector with tight tolerance.
Push bread along tabletop to translate it.
Back away to a safe distance after push.

recovery_strategy: Scan if not visible, then re-detect
Reduce push distance and retry once
Abort with safe retreat if collision risk detected
assumptions: Frames do not clearly show motion direction; push uses direction_deg=90 as a reasonable guess.
Instruction 'move bread' interpreted as pushing on the table rather than pick-and-place due to lack of grasp cues in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Bread position changes by ~0.15 m in commanded direction
